page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This block is a sparsely populated rural area, consisting of a mixture of farmland and semi-natural vegetation. It includes the edge of Mullion village. Tourism and farming form the basis of the local economy. Tourists are attracted by the natural beauty and the proximity of the sea. Mixed farming is practised_ fodder crops, early vegetables and flowers are grown; cattle are kept for milk and beef. A mulberry tree,still growing in the grounds of Bochym Manor, is mentioned in the Domesday Book. The Manor now caters for tourists. Holiday accommodation is found in the block, mainly camp sites, self-catering cottages and farmhouse bed and breakfasts. Unemployment is high, particularly in the winter when tourists are absent.
